text: Great little sushi bar. Affordable and quaint. Service was exceptional and food tasted great. Their rolls are a decent size and they offer quite a variety. Can't beat the buy 2 get 1 free special. Bento boxes also come with a lot of food at a decent price. Overall, our experience was great and we'll definitely be back!
I ordered the 7 piece sushi combo, two of the pieces are not what I would expect, one was tofu and one was the fake crab fish you see used in place of crab. At 18.00, this was a disappointment.

I always come here for my lunch break since I work right next door . Their food is delicious and not to mention when you buy two rolls you get one free of your choice!! Staff is always great and never overlooks a customer . I always get the crunchy dragon roll and I never get tired of it . I give my money and business to them happily every time !
This is by far my favorite sushi place. They have really good quality fish and ramen. I had the crunchy shrimp roll and the tempura was excellent
Food wasn't bad, service was lacking though.  There are too many good sushi places to waste time at a mediocre establishment.
Amazing!!! 42 different sushi rolls and I've yet to taste a bad one. My lame girlfriend also likes to tag along but she lacks the refined palate to properly review this joint.

Decided to dine here after trying many other sushi places in the area. This is definitely the best! Everything we ordered was amazing & tasted very fresh. The service was great. 

The restaurant is decorated nicely and is comfortable, whether sushi bar or table. They have TVs that were playing the games. Overall great restaurant! Can't wait to return.
Delicious!!! The oysters are amazing. A wide variety of choices and the staff is very friendly. A regular sushi stop for us.
Excellent sushi restaurant.  Prices just right. Wish they had an all you can eat deal.

Great service and food!! The communication from the waitress to the chief was amazing. Very friendly and family oriented place. Tried the Aloha ,"Mistake", and the Rainbow roll. All were great!  My 6 yr old son plowed through the Bento lunch box and was happy. Would definitely eat here again the next time we are in town.
This place is the bomb!  Not too crowded yet and still the freshest fish on this side of town. Taste sushi at the AYCE places then come here. You an taste the difference!!

Great find on our vacation. Our favorites were the dinner bento boxes (good amount of shrimp and veggie tempura and quality beef and chicken teriyaki). Great sashimi grade fish (we got the deluxe/sashimi B). Our favorite rolls were the Bonzai, caterpillar and the In-and-out (they have a buy 2 rolls get one free promo). Iced and hot green tea were good. 

You can't see inside the restaurant when you are walking past it so it might discourage some folks to come in but they are open. The staff are welcoming and warm. We went to this place twice during our 5 day vacation.

I've been here twice and they haven't let me down! The chef and hostess are very friendly and welcoming. They remembered me from about a month ago which is always a plus in my book. I came for lunch and got the Sushi B combo. It was the perfect amount of food and was very affordable. The quality of fish meets my standards!

All I can say is, Yelp let me down on this one. Everything we had was mediocre. 
The staff was very nice though.

The rolls were fresh and had a great combination of subtle flavor. The overall vibe, was relaxed and great for a dinner date. It was an amazing experience, great food great service. will definitely come back.

Steve, Master Sushi Chef, selects and prepares all the fish himself.  He gives each piece his full attention and love...yes, love!  We taste the love in each dish he serves us, and because of this, our lives are even more filled with love!!!
Have a seat at his sushi bar and get ready to have the Very Best Sushi Chef serve you the best of the best!!!
Neil, Whinnie, and crew help Steve with serving and our cravings are more than satisfied!  When we leave, we are planning our next visit. 
Go see for yourself!  In Sawa Sushi, you are treated as honored guest with true Japanese spirit.  
Sawa Sushi is our treasure!!!

We go in, sit at his bar, no need of menu...just trust him to provide you the most heavenly treats!  We have learned so very much from him, how he selects his fish, his uni, and we try anything he offers.  This is, by far, our most favorite and loved Sushi in the universe!!!
Love from Patti & Steve

And yes, they do serve alcohol, the best oyster shooters, sake, beer, and wine!

We've been coming here for about nine months now, we love the food, service is excellent, we manage coming for Binto Box often, we were just there and brought a friend, she was amazed, we will continue to come and continue to bring our friends.  Thank you for opening the great place so close to us.
Favorite sushi spot. Chef is awesome and quality of the fish and rice is above other sushi bars here in vegas.

Simply excellent. Sawa definitely rises above the typical sushi clutter where every roll begins to taste the same; unique flavors, well balanced. You know the food is good when you don't need to add anything (sauce, spices, etc.). Staff was incredibly friendly, attentive, and welcoming. Best sushi experience I've had in Vegas. Must check it out!

The food here is so amazing every time I come the food is just as irresistible as last time! The quality is consistent! Steven and Michi offer such great service! Some restaurants are good sometimes depending on certain times of day and different cooks.  Steven the owner is here 7 days a week making sushi so there is quality control 100%. I have been here many times. Here is the Cajun Salmon Salad
This place is so good! Great customer service. My husband and I go gee often. We love to get the Snow White roll. It's amazing!!

I am really hesitant to write this review, because I am afraid this place is going to get too crowded. Probably the best Sushi place I have been to in a very long time! And believe me, I can distinguish between good and bad sushi. All the fish tastes like it was still swimming 10 minutes ago. The rolls are awesome and selection is huge. I will be a regular there for sure. The owner is the sushi chef himself and the staff is friendly and welcoming. Highly recommended!

Excellent!
We drove by Sawa Sushi and spontaneously decided to give it a try and are so very glad we did. Great service, delicious food (we tried Sushi & Bento Box)

Chef/owner is a humble happy man.

Absolutely recommendable

This great little sushi restaurant is tucked away in a nondescript strip mall about 10 minutes from the Strip. The sushi here is really delicious: everything is super fresh and beautifully presented.  There is a huge assortment of rolls available, and prices were extremely reasonable.  I highly recommend leaving the strip to enjoy this much tastier alternative.
Excellent sushi! The fresh fish is delicious and the service is great! I will definitely return.

My go too Japanese restaurant that is not all you can eat, which I do not always want to eat. Quality is good, love there white tuna nigiri and there bento boxes. I'm sad my favorite waitresses seems like she no longer works there anymore. The owner/sushi chef is very friendly and recognizes his usual suspects. Come support them.

The best ever. The Tuna is Ruby Red, not pink!

Open a yelp account just for this review. Don't waste your time with other location.
Great Sushi! Bring friends, Chef has over 30 years of experience! Highly recommended!

This is a pretty small simple place but the customer service is excellent! They greet you as soon as you walk in the door and are very polite and always offering to refill your drink or even give you some advise on what they recommend on sushi.  The sushi here is excellent and has a very unique style and taste.  They make it very quick and it looks like a work of art.  Prices here are really good and have some pretty good promos for ex. They have buy 2 sushi rolls and get one free.  Honestly there's nothing I could think of to improve this place. It's just a great place to eat.

5 stars because Steven always goes above and beyond to welcome you himself, and pay attention to every need. Extra jalapeños or sauce, menu suggestions etc. We love the bonsai roll. Everything tastes so fresh and the rolls come out quickly. The buy two get one free is awesome! Try the spicy edamame. Delicious!

Decent choice for sushi for the southwest area.  The buy two rolls, get one free is a good deal. And in my opinion, helps balance out the small-ish portions.  The nigri portions were also a bit small, but made up for by its freshness and buttery texture.

Service was prompt, attentive, without being intrusive. 

Place seemed to attract some regulars, which is always a positive sign. 

Just wish their mug for their hot tea came with a handle. When the tea is piping hot, the handle-less design of the mug made it difficult to drink the tea without scalding your hand/fingers. Oh well.

I absolutely love this place! My family and I have been coming here since the beginning! They always remember who we are. Great friendly family place with even greater food! I love the all the rolls here and always get SUPER FULL!! Thank you sawa!
By far one of the best quality sushi places we have ever been to. Good service. Great sushi. Fresh. Great portions.
The food was good, Bento Box portions were very generous.  The sushi was good and came out quickly.

This place has been great! It was new and had a good special going on so we checked it out. The service has always been very warm and friendly and will keep us coming back. The sushi has been very enjoyable each time and tastes fresh. I also particularly liked the baked oysters, baked scallop roll and coconut shrimp roll. It has a local neighborhood warm feel to it too. Definitely check it out.
I love this place! Every time I come the sushi chef make sure to be real kind and full if joy! The sushi is real fresh and melts in your mouth! Happy happy customer!
Excellent fresh sushi in a cozy atmosphere. Owners are super nice and you are always greeted when you walk in the door.

Best sushi place I've been to in Vegas. Very attentive staff and not very crowded on a Friday around 5:00pm. Very fresh sushi and great beer and sake deals. Not to forget the buy 2 rolls get 1 free special they have. Highly recommend!!!
Great local spot!! Owner chef is a talented and nice guy and the food is perfect for a neighborhood sushi spot!!!

So good!! I was in town for only a short time and saw the reviews and figured I would give it a try. Outstanding. The hospitality, the atmosphere, and most of all the food. You gotta check out my guy Nikko. The guy is a sushi master. Such a good experience. HIGHLY recommended. Enjoy!

Awesome place. The staff are all super friendly always without missing a beat. The fish is always very fresh and tasty.. I even see how they are on point ordering it as they need and not over ordering .. Definitely a place to try..

I'm new to the area so I decided to Google sushi Sawa happen to be less than a mile away from where I was.
 Boy am I glad that they there. The fish was so fresh the customer service was excellent I will eat there again
Not that good, the roll was tiny and overpriced. The fish was pretty fresh but the portion size was horrible, i was still hungry.  The service was ok but if your on a diet come try this place.

Excellent. Great prices and nice portions. We had the fried chicken appetizer. The breading was light and the dipping sauce spicy. Mister ordered the ramen, which was just ok (but he was comparing to Monta-not fair). The seaweed and cucumber salads were healthy portions. I had the Himachi Kama...yummy! We had a couple of nigiri and fish tasted fresh.
The tuna was not as fresh as I hoped for.  It's not a bad place for fast sushi service.  I would go back but stay away from tuna.

Casual, ok service, nothing special, sushi tastes ok, fresh because it is still new (grand opening in March).  BE PREPARED to smell like fried food after dinning in (seriously need a better ventilation).

"DHA, In & Out, and Mistake Maki" are the best out of everything in the menu (if you only order maki roll).

New sushi restaurant with pretty decent sushi. I'm not too crazy about this place but I come here to enjoy the Sawa Boat. The boat comes with assorted nigiri and a two rolls of your choice. The fish was pretty fresh. I was a bit disappointed to find out that they font have AYCE though. I feel like this place isn't special and worth ordering individual order and so I only wish they had ACYE. The Miso Soup was average and the Cucumber Salad was extremely sour. The Philadelphia roll is made with Smoked Salmon so be aware if you're not a fan of it. Their varieties of crunchy rolls were pretty good and the size of the rolls are pretty big. The sushi chef is highly energetic and quick to make our orders and I was impressed that he memorized the orders based on the waiter just telling him. The waiter was amazing too. She was a quick worker, extremely friendly and always attentative of her surroundings. She would engage in conversations with the guest but as soon as an order was ready, she brought it to the tables immediately. If we were unhappy was any dish, they were kind to redo our orders to satisfy us. Very good service and food, but don't know if it's worth it unless they had All You Can Eat.
There are not many restaurants in the area but this is definitely a good one! Plus oif you order 2 rolls, the 3rd one is free.

Have been here a couple times now...food comes fast and is really good, tho i wish they had "all you can eat".  So why only 3 stars? Both times i have come here i have had the same waitress who has ZERO personality!  So much so that it made us feel really uncomfortable.  She barely says anything to you and instead of asking if we were ready to order, she walked up to the table and just stared at me until i got uncomfortable enough to just order.  Despite having tasty food, i dont know if we will come back.
They entice you with their Buy Two Get One Free sushi variety but nothing stands out on taste and the sushi portions are SMALL!  Pricing is $$
I was visiting Vegas one weekend and yelped this sushi restaurant.  The food was delicious and their prices are more than reasonable.  Will definitely visit this place again.
Best sushi ever! The people working here was so welcoming and nice!! The food was amazing!
Food was really good.  Service was awesome.  I only rate it a 3 because the ambiance is a little boring and they should really offer AYCE.  I'd actually give a 3 /12 if I could ;)
Sushi was good, and so was service. The seafood tasted and looked fresh. The buy 2 get one free is definitely a plus.

Love this place. Excellent, fresh fish. The sauces will blow your mind. LOVE the garlic albacore roll!!The chef is way friendly and knows his sushi. Cool interior with a laid back feel. Best sushi in the area no joke

I'm not sure which was worse, the food or the service. The rolls were small and tasteless. When asked to switch out one type of fish for another (allergies) we were assured no problem and it came back with the fish I was allergic to! Waitress was apathetic at best, and indignant, rude, and completely inattentive at worst. Would never go to again.

Reasonably priced. Not excessive, nor cheap. The girl who complained about liquor, they serve it now not a reason to give them low stars, it's a new place and the were waiting for licence also if you prefer coke products more than Pepsi you shouldn't give them bad rating just because they carry Pepsi....that's personal preference and doesn't define a spot.  

I mostly order to go, I ate sitting down once, they are fast, listen well, and super friendly!  I love close this location so to go works for me. 

The Vegas AYCE mentality isn't present here to which all I can is thank goodness!

I love this sushi place! The service is great and so is the food! I haven't had anything I didn't like! They have a great special buy two rolls get one free! I am super allergic to avocado and they made sure to do additional sanitation on both the sushi equipment and the bar! I can't wait to go back!

Such a great place. Sushi rolls were delicious and they have a wide selection. A large Sapporo, which I usually get anyway at a sushi place, comes with a free glass of saki! Service was amazing and the price was great. Get the #39 roll. You won't be disappointed.

Really good service you can pretty much seat yourself not a big deal which I like! I had uní for the first time ever and it was surprising good!! I adore the buda roll and appreciate the fresh wasabi! House saki is bomb and good raspberry iced tea. My new go to

My boyfriend and I wanted for sushi for lunch and Sawa was close by his house. So we decided to give it a try. It was a good choice because they have buy 2 get the 3 roll for free! We really loved the Volcano Roll. That was one of our favorites. I'd definitely recommend it if you like spicy! The service was amazing because our server kept checking in with us to ensure we were satisfied with our sushi rolls. 

I'd definitely come back again! :)

Chose to stop here because of the Yelp reviews. Charming decor. Staff was very friendly. We had the seafood salad and 3 rolls. 'd the Volcano roll. The buy two get one free is a great deal. We'll definitely be back.

Sawa is a small, clean, and inviting sushi restaurant. The staff is friendly and attentive and the sushi chef is knowledgeable and very talented. The sashimi is delicate and pure tasting. Very fresh and an excellent variety. I highly recommend this little gem to anyone that likes true Japanese style sushi.

Kind service--prompt and courteous. I loved it. Food was so good and they have the best cucumber salads around. The miso was great and even though I was a simple "to go" buyer, I was treated with the same care and quickness that a person eating in would get. Well worth it and great value for what you buy.
Great local spot and great service...everyone seemed to be greeted when they came in. Yummy dragon roll, spicy tuna roll and the mistake roll is NO mistake! Our favorite.

The freshest sushi on the west side of town. A hidden gem. I've been to this shopping plaza on a weekly basis and never saw this place tucked in beside in and out. Dynamite roll and the garlic edamame were delicious. I'm going back!

Went here on the fiance's whim, and I was pleasantly surprised at how awesome customer service is here. Sushi was pretty good too. 
I liked our waitress for her attentive and friendliness. I could also tell that the sushi chef we got to see at their opening hour likes to recognize his regulars. He even acknowledges patrons seated away from the sushi bar. Granted that the restaurant is small for size. 
We didn't get to eat a lot 'cause I wasn't very hungry that day, but I did enjoy the Red Volcano sushi the most. 
In terms of pricing, we spent about $37-$40 (not including gratuity) for 3 rolls, 1 seaweed salad and 2 waters. Trust me when I say that I went easy during this meal. I'll update after our next visit when I'll grub down more.
I LOVE SAWA SUSHI.  They always greet me with a smile and deliver the freshest cut fish I think Vegas offers.  Best value for the money!

My wife and I come here anytime we are in the mood for sushi . They are always super friendly and quick to help you. We have tried a few other places in the area and this is still or favorite. They have a great deal on rolls and they taste great. If you want something made special they will put it together for you. Great place for sure will keep coming back.
Sushi was great for the price.  Not a ton of ambience but lots of variety, fresh tasting and delicious. Friendly service.
Were sushi snobs and loved this place. Their sashimi was incredibly fresh. The tempura was crispy and delicious. Will come back!

This is now one of my new favorite neighborhood sushi places. It is easy to miss this little restaurant as it is swallowed up by a huge strip mall boasting a Target, Kohls, Big Lots and many more large retailers and fast food franchises alike. It is tucked away next to Kosters finance on Blue Diamond between Arville and Decatur. They have a great lunch menu offering bento boxes, sushi specials and the usual protein or veggies with teriyaki sauce and the fixings of miso soup and salad. They do not offer AYCE but their speciality rolls are buy 2 get 1 free making it very reasonably priced without the pressure of stuffing your face to get your money's worth out of AYCE prices. The fish is fresh, and rolls  wonderfully crafted with the right amount of rice to fish ratio. They also have a special on their beverages; buy one large Sapporo and get a free bottle of sake to share. The rolls vary in price, but average at about $10/$11 per roll.. of course if taking advantage of their special that brings the average prices down by a bit. The staff is courteous and attentive and the restaurant appears clean with simple, modern decor.

Amazing sushi, WOW is the correct word i wanna use for this sushi restaurant.

my 10 yr old and 7 yr old, wife and i...

Good every bite

I order 8 sushi varieties and all i can say is... i'm coming back for more...

Great Spot
Good food...enjoyed the Bento Box
Great Value for the Money
Good atmosphere as well
Great sushi and great service kinikko is a great sushi chief definitely will be back. Great prices really good fish

Checking for a great sushi place in South Las Vegas we came across this great find!  The Sushi Chefs and waitresses greeted us as we walked in the door.  The rolls were fantastic and the sushi was amazing.   We had 6 rolls between the 4 of us dining and each one was awesome.  5 stars for the Dragon, Rainbow, Garlic Albacore, (2) Red Volcano, and Spicy Lobster Rolls - all highly recommended! Can't wait to come back and it may be tomorrow night.  Simply stated:  Great atmosphere, great service and great sushi!
Sushi is always fresh and tasty. I never see it extremely packed, which is great around dinner time. Its nice and quiet, and not too noisy. Purchase two specialty rolls, and receive one FREE.
Amazing sushi at Sawa Sushi. What a find.  We didn't want to go to the strip and we ate here. Steven is the owner and his real  name is Sawa.

Been wanting to try this place for a while and I'm glad we tried it today. My kids loved it too. The bento boxes are very generous and the rolls are yummy. The service was great and great ambiance. The buy 2 get one free a great deal. Will definitely go back.
Who knows how it is?  I came in, sat down at 2pm. Only 2 other tables occupied. Was handed a menu. And never saw a waitress again. Waited about 5 minutes. Then I left.

Fresh food everyday and consistent with servings and proportions. Come in and be greeted with a Japanese gusto lol chef and server are Japanese. This place is one of Las Vegas' hidden gems if you want to get away from the crowded strip like most locals do. 5 stars. Indubitably.

I was not impressed with this place, their barely busy but when they are the sushi Chefs take their sweet time watching tv. When I order one roll to go on my dinner break from work and it's $8 that has literally 4 pieces and it took them 25 mins to make and it wasn't great and just bland I won't be returning.
Came here with my lady and we are never going anywhere else. The ichiban and red volcano rolls are addicting. Chef Sawa and Aaron- you're killing bros!

Pretty stoked on this place. First time here and the nigiri and sashimi was very fresh. My mom just moved here from Japan (where I grew up) and I've had a really hard time finding a sushi spot that impresses her. We were both really happy tonight. Not only were the pieces really fresh but they were nice and thick as well. Looking forward to coming back. If the quality is always this good then I'd have to say that this is one of the better sushi places in town. 

Update: Went back exactly one week later and ordered the same sashimi platter and the cuts were not as fresh and were not nearly as thick. It was still fresh but with the cuts being smaller, it's going to be hard spending the money on the sashimi platter again. Also the nigiri was smaller as well. I'll give it another try. They had two chefs there and I'm not sure if we had one the first week and then the other the second. Notice the slits in the nigiri in my pictures. The nigiri didn't have those the second time we went. Hmmmm. Dropped it a star because of this.

So just grabbing a few things at Target and hit up the Yelp app for a quick nearby bite. Loved this place, cozy, very friendly staff, sushi Chefs were super fast and made awesome rolls. Definitely recommend this place for any fellow sushi lovers out there.

The food is delicious, they have a decent amount of items in their menu, and have good prices and a buy 2 get 1 free deal on their sushi rolls. The inside of the building is full of Japanese decorations, the employees are very friendly and all say hi to each and every customer that walks in.
good place to dine in?Had several great rolls?Dha?rainbow and in&out are really tasty?

First time here, very nice fresh and will come back, had the Salmon Bento box.
My wife have the beef teriyaki box, plenty of food and prices are very reasonable.

Ok, this place is small and unassuming...located in a strip mall in front of Target!  You might miss it if you are not looking for it!  That is where I wonder whether I should Yelp this from the rooftops...or stealth Yelp to only my dearest!  

So, let's start with Michi...amazing service!  She makes you feel like the chef is working just for you!  So very attentive..never a glass empty...never a dirty plate to linger...wish I could take her home!

The sushi was absolutely out of this world! I could not ask for anything better! Fresh, well-managed, so flavorful! They have specials buy two rolls can't one for me! Appetizers are perfect! We really enjoyed The spicy garlic edamame  and then we ordered the Ichi Bon, spicy garlic albacore roll and the red rock volcano roll! All of them absolutely delicious!

Super Secret yelp tip!! Try fresh wasabi root! Really makes your food Pop! This place offers it and doesn't charge extra! At Nobu it's $12! Enjoy!

Sawa Sushi just opened up not too long ago and I decide to give it try. (FYI this visit was back in March.) Any hoot and holler I always thought the location was an odd choice to open up a sushi place because it's not the busiest shopping center but hey let's hope it helps attract business. 

The small Resturant was just that "small" as soon as you open the door you have to duck under this Japanese curtain thing they have over the front of the door whenever entering or existing the establishment which is kindda in the way in my opinion. Staff greets you immediately and you don't go far to be seated. There is a sushi bar with pull up stool in the back right corner of the Resturant which makes up most of the place and table with booth type seating on either safe of the room. 

The menu is simple with quit a few options to tickle your taste buds. I came with my pregnant wife and 1 year old daughter. So naturally we asked for cooked sushi roll suggestions and the waitress was more then helpful. 

We order a few Special sushi to receive a free roll and a Teriyaki chicken bento box. Ok so it is pretty awesome to find a good, affordable place to grab a quick bento box I mean this box is a perfect fix and comes with all the goodies. Teriyaki chicken, rice, salad, tempura veggies and shrimp and a good size sushi roll. A great portion of food all for about $11 or $12 on top of that you get a cup of miso soups as well. With had a great taste with small bits of tofu floating in it. 

Besides the curtains in the entrance all in all it was a good little joint that I will defiantly come back to. The food was good, the Resturant was nice and the staff was friendly. Please come and try them I would love for them to stick around. 

Good luck Sawa Sushi hope you are here for a long time!
Excellent rolls!  Fast, fresh with great service!  My fave was the garlic albacore roll!  Will definitely be back!

I am an extreme sushi snob, so I don't think the food is exceptional here. However they give you a lot for your money here and for that, this place is a good value. I usually come here for lunch and the lunch specials (bento box) are $8.95 or $9.95. it's never crowded there during lunch hours. The food comes out very quickly, which I like as well. They also have good specials such as buy two specialty rolls and get one free. Again, it makes this place a very good value.
I don't know if I'm reading into this or not, but there seems to be an extremely high turnover rate among servers here. I don't think I've ever seen the same person twice. My only other minor gripe about this place is the very old-school Japanese music that is playing on repeat in the background. I don't think my parents would even listen to that anymore. It could be a little livelier in there but for the money, it's fine.

Nikko is UH-MAZ-ING! He made our first experience awesome! His "Special" (The onion lover/Vampires nightmare) rolls were outstanding!! We were celebrating my friends birthday and had a great time! 
We didn't know what to expect because it's located in a strip mall parking lot, but after reading reviews, (which were good) we decided to give it a shot and so glad we did!
If you don't try this place, you ARE seriously missing out!!!
Very fresh sushi. Great prices. And amazing service. Doesn't get much better than that!

Thank you Yelp! I was in town for an event and tried this place based off the reviews. 
So good that I have been twice in 2 days. Dinner and lunch.  Hopefully I get by one more time before I head home. Food and service is Fast, Friendly & Fresh! The interior is nice, clean, quiet and with an unassuming atmosphere. I really like cooked sushi so, that is what I had here. The menu has a good selection of both raw and cooked plus the other usual items. Yes it is located in a strip center but the food is perfectly prepared, presented and oh so delicious! Extra bonus at lunch I sat at the bar and got to enjoy the Chef who was singing along to the Pop R&B music (very well I might add) and just loving life!

Was on my way out of town when I found Sawa on Yelp. Lived up to their great reputation! Had their buy 2 get 1 free Sushi Rolls and they were very yummy! Tried the Ichiban, Hawaiian and Dragon Roll and all were excellent - Hawaiian was my favorite (very unique flavor). Also had very friendly and quick service. Definitely will come back next year during my annual trip to Las Vegas.
Thanks for a great lunch I appreciate the service. I recommend this place for quick bites.

The food here is amazing. Everything I've ever order is great and I highly recommend the chicken ramen. 

The service however is consistently terrible. There is always only one server working no matter how busy and I think once she may have also been helping in the kitchen because it took us over an hour to get our food. One visit, we gave up and just left, because we had to get to the airport and in my opinion waiting an hour for food in a restaurant with only three tables is a little ridiculous. 

I'd love to give it 5 stars but the management clearly needs to hire more staff to avoid long wait time and food coming out cold.

What a gem! Did not expect a little Japanese restaurant located in a mini mall to be this delightful! Everything is great; sushi, udon, teriyaki, tempura... all standard and moderately priced. A surprising item on the menu is the sashimi salad. YUM! The salad dressing is delicious... light and crisp, hint of sesame. Gotta try it!

Received excellent customer service , they have a great special for a free sake with the purchase of a large Sapporo which was awesome since I wanted a good beer anyway , wife and I ordered the Sawa boat it was awesome , presented very well and was delicious we chose the rainbow roll and the oshi roll we were very happy and will come back again ! Thanks for making us full .
Love this place! The sushi chefs are super friendly and make incredible, fresh rolls. Was really happy to find such a great sushi place close to home!

Went to this place last night for the first time. Very sub par. Service is good, but the fish is not fresh and also they are very short with the amount of fish given. Price is too high for the amount of fish they give. Biggest factor is that the fish isn't fresh.
I wasn't expecting much.  But was very Suprised by the quality of the sushi.   Prices were reasonable and very good service

Can't wait to come back and stuff my pie hole full of more deliciousness from here...
Appetizers of himachi collar and the crab and cheese cake was sooooooo good.

Just came here for a quick lunch and had the spicy tuna miso salad. Not that much to Say about the salad you see what you get in the Pic I posted. Salad was nice and fresh and so was the sushi. The service was great, chefs were attentive and asked how everything was and waiter kept refilling my water. Time to try the lunch specials next time!

Some days you get really lucky and the day finishes with wonderful people like Steven at Sawa.  The Salmon Toro was heavenly.  Hamachi, Kani, Unagi Nigiri all amazing.  I've been in a different city almost every day and frankly not feeling quite myself.  One hour at Sawa, and I was not only smiling, but just enjoying every taste.  Thank you Steven and Sawa!
Would never go back. Terrible quality food. Bad service. Ignored allergy requests. Rolls put together sloppily.
LOVE coming here! The service is always speedy and friendly, and the food is always fresh. Love the large Sapporo and free sake, and the buy two rolls, get one free.

This place serves really good food at a very reasonable price. Operated by Japanese, staff are polite, and it's clean. We ordered a Teriyaki Salmon Bento and 2 rolls special with Spicy Tuna and spicy Scallop roll all for under 20 bucks. The teriyaki sauce is by far the best that I've ever tasted in long long time, tempura in the bento were perfectly made, I would say, food made with heart. If you are around area and like Japanese food, this place is a no brainier. Definitely gonna come back for other stuff.
Such a lucky find! Food is delicious and the staff was great! We will definitely be back. The Snow White was my favorite!

We have forever been an I Love Sushi and only I Love Sushi fan until a co-worker told us about this place. First of all free sake with a large Sapporo then buy 2 get 1 free on all rolls. It was fantastic. Good service. Great fresh sushi especially for my special requests. We highly recommend this place for delicious sushi !! 
~ a self admitted sushi snob!
Fresh fish, and excellent service by the nice server rose, chef took time to make our order nicely done and the rice is not too much

We stopped here on our way back to our place and got sushi to go. 

Looked at the menu and didn't really see anything we liked (we really like fresh fish on top) and a lot of their rolls were cooked or had tempera in it. 

So we decided to create our own rolls--and they said they wouldn't mind doing it! 

The staff was soooo nice and helpful with getting the order together.

The sushi chefs quickly accommodated our requests and got the sushi made and to go quickly as we had our baby with us ready for bed and getting a little fussy. 

It as really good sushi and very fresh. :) 
We were very satisfied and would definitely go back!
Rates up there with one of the best meals I've ever had. Fresh fresh fish, ingenious rolls, authentic yakisoba, excellent service. We're from out of town but we'll be back asap!
Great Customer service by Nikko the sushi chef! Highly recommend this place when your in the Area! The rolls are fresh and the best part is you buy 2 and get the 3rd one for free!!!

The service was friendly and attentive (5 stars).

Their buy two get one free roll selection is extensive. We ordered the Monkey Brain, Caterpillar, and Spicy Girl roll and the lowest priced roll was free. All 3 rolls tasted fresh and had delicious sauce. Come here for their rolls!

The sushi was a hit and miss. The Chu Toro sushi (one piece) was fantastic! The Uni (two pieces) was good but small. The Aji was ok. The Hotate (two pieces) lacked texture (more like mush) and did not taste fresh. It was also missing a citrus seasoning. This was listed on their blackboard special but turned out to be a disappointment. Also, the sushi rice fell apart easily...

Overall, it's a 3.5 stars place due to their sushi quantity and quality. The service brings it up to 4 stars.

Plenty of parking available in the shopping center.

This was my 2nd time there for lunch break and I was really disappointed with the service there again. They took 40 mins for me and  my work mate just to get 2 sushi rolls each for the lunch special. They didn't even give us the miso soup that comes with it! We just left because we missed our lunch. Not cool.

I am a regular.  We know sushi.  We have been to all the the top Las Vegas places on the strip.  In all honesty there isn't a place that can beat Sawa Sushi.  The owner is a super nice guy.  Knows where to get the best quality pieces of meat.  We literally eat at Sawa and the next day we were on the strip and tried a top sushi place.  Didn't even compare.  Consider this your Las Vegas insider tip. Sawa Sushi is the best.
Defianately recommend. Excellent service, great sushi. One of the top dragon rolls I've had
Kept it simple ordered the spicy tuna roll and Alaskan roll. Very good and quick service !! Can't wait to go back and try the rest of their rolls :)

Always enjoy lunch or diner. They change the menu as needed. I like the change and it lets you try new things. Love the super white tuna. Only reason it doesn't get 5 is sometimes the sushi is not as cold as I would like. 
Fresh wasabi is always on point to add a fresh spice. Order Godzilla roll every time. My wife likes the cooked rolls. She loves the lasagna. Location is perfect, just wish they had more tables when it's slammed. Don't change the way you do business and we will keep coming in.
After drinking all the night that a best place to fix a hangover. Udon soup was is amazing.
I don't know why it took me so long to find this place ( i guess the exterior was never eye catching ) BUT food was amazing and so fresh ,definitely be going back soon .

Stopped in with a client based on the reviews. I ordered a seaweed salad which was your standard prepackaged fare and the but two special rolls, get one free special.

I went with the Bonzai, Oishi and Starfish rolls. I found the Bonzai and the Starfish to be overdressed with a bit too much vinegar-based sauce and the use of pickled jalapeno instead of fresh jalapeno. 

The Oishi was the best of the rolls as it allowed the flavor of the fish to stand out.

A very generous 3 stars as the service was very good.

This was my first experience here and I loved it. It's small but very cozy.  The staff is all very nice and accommodating.  Their house hot tea is matcha and excellent quality.  They have a unique roll called the coconut shrimp roll which was amazing.  I also loved the Hawaiian roll that comes with fresh thin sliced lemon on top.  Will definitely be back!  I sat right at the sushi bar and visited with the chefs the whole time.  They were so nice!  Go and enjoy!

I love Sawa Sushi! This is definitely my go to place when I get the craving for some Japanese food  I usually order the chicken teriyaki bento box and everything in it is super delish! You get soup, salad, chicken teriyaki, and some tempura for a low price! Plus, we always get such a warm welcome we go. Two thumbs up for Sawa Sushi!

Unbelievable! Can't describe the food enough to do it justice. It was so full of flavor and freshness that even after I was full I was still trying to eat more! The service was fantastic! Beyond words! We are 'out of towners' and swear we'll come back just for the food here!

I would drive past this place all the time. Glad recently I went in. The service was great. Food was affordable. I had the tonkatsu ramen and spider roll. Not busy so my food came out quickly. The specials look like something I'll order next time. I will defiantly be back.

This place is very good,I've liked sushi since 1998,and I just relocated to the Las Vegas area,and this is by far the best sushi place I've eaten at.
The chefs and waitresses are very nice,small but clean and very comfortable place,and I will be going there for lunch today!

Really quaint sushi establishment off the 15. We stopped here craving sushi on our way back from Vegas.

After complimentary pickled cucumbers, we got the sashimi salad (selection of shrimp, tuna, salmon, white fish) and the sashimi platter (3 pieces each of salmon, tuna, white fish).

We also got plain edamame

Overall it was nice was to satisfy our sushi craving but definitely a little pricey for lunch and the quality of the fish, especially given the selection we're used to back in LA.

Very quiet and great service, though!

Came across this on yelp and decided to give it a try for lunch on a Sunday, each of the dishes were very fresh.... and they have a special where you order 2 rolls and get the 3rd for free! Not too bad! Service was good and very clean! All staff are very friendly! Will come back and try other items on their menu!

It has been two years since last eating here and I finally found myself in this area again for dinner.   Craving sushi, I revisited this location and still found good value in this meal.

An offer for buy 2 get 1 free on special rolls posted right outside the complex is what convinced me to dine here.  Special rolls average around $8.50 and up to around $13.  I had the DHA roll again, a shrimp tempura crunch, and a Philadelphia roll.   The DHA roll with spicy yellowtail inside, tuna on top, with the screaming O sauce was good.  

We ordered shrimp tempura, green mussels, gyoza, and a cali roll for the kids.   All portions were good for the money.  The total came to be right at $50; good for feeding a family of four.  

The restaurant was not busy at all so getting our food and server's attention was fairly fast.  An improvement from my last visit, I would return to eat here if I find myself nearby again.

Great little sushi bar! Love the small, relaxed atmosphere. The sushi really was very good. The girlfriend and I split a few special rolls and left full. They currently have a deal of buy two special rolls and get the third free. 

No, it doesn't have AYCE  nor do they have a happy hour. Not every sushi bar in Las Vegas needs to be AYCE!

It is fairly average-priced for a sushi bar, but the quality certainly appeared to be excellent.

We spent roughly $40 for four large rolls and hot tea (before tip). Roughly $10 less than AYCE - but we still left full and it was better quality than most AYCE places.

Happy this place is here! I love the selection and they're deals are great. Sushi is buy two rolls get one free. Also, if you buy a large Sapporo you get free hit sake! Yum it's so perfect and right down the street from us.
I absolutely love Sawa sushi they are friendly and fun and the food is delicious! Crunchy dragon roll is a fave of mine.

Good staff and great sushi. Other than the one customer making all the noise being rude and saying he was such a regular there, great time out. The buy 2 get 1 free special rolls is a good deal. Try the ibachi roll and garlic albacore roll.
(Late Review) Small place and small menu, but nice atmosphere. They chefs were nice and friendly. I would go back again! Give this place a try!.
My new Sushi place! Not crowded, good music, sports on TV, and the freshest sushi outside of SFO. #DELISH
Grand opening and reasonable price! Great place to eat sushi! Good services! I really like their special maki!

Sawa Sushi is awesome. We eat sushi all over Las Vegas and Sawa is now my favorite. We ordered a Chicken teriyaki bento box for our two boys (6 & 4) they LOVED it.  We ordered Krabbi Patty, Japenese Lasagna, and Crispy Shrimp.  All AMAZING. ILL BE BACK.
Excellent food. Good quality. Great service. Reasonable price. Generous portions. Satisfyingly delicious. Friendly and relaxing atmosphere.
Really enjoyed the sushi here.  It was a yelp  find and we did the buy 2 rolls,.get one free.  Great deal for the money, and the rolls were delicious.

I hate when cooks and servers are already ready to leave before the establishment closing time. It makes me feel rushed and can't even enjoy my dinner. I wouldn't recommend the udon. I order udon a lot when I go to sushi restaurants and this place was just meh. The rolls are just okay too. We got a sushi boat and two sashimi platters. Hubby said sashimi was good but nothing to rave about. Service was okay too. Hubby and I came here once a couple months ago and had such a great experience we wanted to bring our family when we were back in Vegas. We all agreed this time around everything was just "alright" so i don't think we'll be coming back.

I'm obsessed!!! From the the Spicy Lobster Roll, To the classic a California roll which I never order, and I was pleasantly surprised, everything was so fresh.  Steven the owner was a class act, Jane was friendly and so genuine.  Brittany was also a gem!!!! Loved the whole staff!!!! So impressed... will make it my new Joint!!!!
Always fabulous food and friendly staff. Love their Buy 2 Get one Free! Their Salmon dinner was LARGE and delicious,
Awesome place, friendly people and just outstanding food, I will defiantly be back when I'm back in town. Thank you Sawa Sushi!!!!!!!

There are a lot of high reviews and 5 stars for this place and I am confused as to why. I in no way consider myself a Sushi snob. I even like sushi from the grocery store in a crunch. 

Let me start by saying, this food here is good it just wasn't 5 star good. I have been looking for a new AYCE but haven't found one that I'm in love with so I thought I would give this place a try. 

I ordered the volcano that everyone raves about and was given something else entirely. When I mentioned to the chef that I didn't think that this is what I had ordered and I thought that it had shrimp tempura in it (as opposed to the crab/mayo mix), he told me "oh, that's something else." -Well, not according to the pictures on Yelp. I'll never know how good it is because I wasn't given one. I didn't hate what I got. It just wasn't my thing and unfortunately it didn't appear that I had a choice and for $13.95 I was annoyed. Look at the picture that I posted and the picture of every other volcano...

I also ordered yellowtail and scallop nigiri. Both were okay but there was too much rice and the rice seemed chilled. (NOT a good thing) Since I was still hungry, I ordered a Salmon hand roll. Again, nothing to write home about, cold rice. I spent over $40 with tip and didn't even get what I wanted. 

The food was average.
The atmosphere was average
The service was just below average (but came with a warm smile)
-and this is the kicker - 
The price was above average.

I don't mind paying top dollar for top quality, presentation and atmosphere but it just wasn't there. I regret not trying out a new AYCE place instead, at least if I didn't like it much, I would have gotten to order more Nigiri, soup, salad AND a roll for less $. Overall, I've just had better.

It might be okay for the buy 2 get one free roll deal or bento boxes or various soups, but for the hardcore sushi lover, not so much....
This is one of the best sushi places we have tried in Las Vegas. Nice small location. Great specials on food and drinks. We will definitely be coming back.
Small place but the food is really good especially the bento box. The server Rose is very accommodating and knows what she's doing. This service with a smile even in crunch time.
I love this place wonderful food  great service Best Sushi ever. Love it 100% recommend
I loved everything. The fish was sublime. The rolls were great and the vibe was AWESOME...

Lots of frozen fish just like other all you can eat places. Then what is their special? Do they make their own sauce? What's their original? Nothing is unique. They use the same stuff as AYCE but charge us more because they are alacarte? Doesn't worth it.
Also I felt uncomfortable the chef/ owner?s attitude to the customers. RUDE. It's funny.
Oh what was that I saw near the bathroom behind the kitchen? Was that a roach? Eww. Right after that they were on dirty dining.
I gave them one star because the service was ok.
Very intimate and friendly.  We had an in and out roll, dragon roll,  and Rainbow roll as well as uni.  Everything was fresh and delicious.

Stepped in for lunch during work. I wanted to treat myself so I orders one of the sushi combos for $9 dollars and it comes with 4 nigiri sushi and a spicy salmon roll. The miso soup flavor reminded me of the miso soup that I had when I was in Japan back in 2001. Great memories.

Awesome place! Everything was fresh and so good!! The staffs are very nice and welcoming as well and gave us an exceptional A+ service. I highly recommend this place, will come back for more for sure :D

Juust had a very enjoyable evening at Sawa Sushi. The food was awesome, sashimi was fresh and clean tasting. Beer was ice cold and Sake warm. Have eaten Sushi all over the US and this place is a little gem! Prices are decent service good. The spicy garlic Edamame are Slammin! A Must Try if in Vegas!

Fantastic sushi! My new local favorite! Great service, modern traditional decor, comfortable seating! The staff remember me each time I go in. I highly recommend the rainbow roll for standard traditional favorites  and aloha roll for nice jalapeño zing! There are other varieties as well. Whenever I hit a new sushi place my test is the nigiri. Perfect cuts of fresh fish every time! They are consistent, but willing to create as well! Try this!

I will definitely go back here ! Everyone was so friendly and attentive. It was Nikko's first day and I felt like he had been working there forever lol .. He made my sushi PERFECT!! Thank you Nikko :)

The chef/owner of the place is Chef Steven. He's cool. The sushi he makes is a perfect balance of rawness and cooked goodness. I, personally, do love the taste of raw tuna and salmon as long as it doesn't taste too 'raw'  if that makes sense. We loved all of the rolls we ordered (DHA, Maui Maui Roll, and red volcano). I highly recommend any of them. You can taste the great quality of the fish they get. Chef Steven is also very friendly and passionate about his restaurant so just him being there creates a great atmosphere.

Unfortunately, there was one server that kinda killed he whole vibe. I read one review and it seems they've described her as well. She basically just dropped off the menu on our table and left. The older Asian lady was much, much nicer...so she saved it. 

Judging overall, we'll most likely come back here. We really liked the restaurant, the food, and the chef. Feed me with some good food and engage me in some good conversation, and you've won me over. That's good enough for me.

Tragically I was just visiting Vegas when I stumbled across this place.  The prices and the sushi are excellent. The Las Vegas Roll is one of the best things ive ever eaten. Will definitely return next time i'm in the state.
Two visits here. This place is solid for service and quality. No AYCE and no draft beer are my only issues. Very clean. Friendly staff.

We've been here three times and we've found the food to be consistently of good quality and service reliable. The place is kid friendly as well. 

They have special rolls with an ongoing buy 2 get 1 free offer. We've tried something different with each visit and so far all is good. Nigiri is fresh. Bento boxes have generous portions and appetizers are good. 

I usually go for AYCE Japanese places but will make an exception for this which is now our go to sushi place in the neighborhood.

This place is my new go to sushi spot. Not only was it delicious but everyone there were so welcoming and friendly  AND it's right down the street from me. Dangerous, but oh so good!! They had a buy 2 get one free special. I had their Red Volcano, Japanese Lasagna and one with scallops on top (sorry, can't remember the name). I'm sure regardless of what you order, it'll be just as good.  I ended the night with some yummy fried banana and green tea ice cream. Great, now I'm craving for more sushi from this place.

I would actually give this a negative star if I could....we ordered the boat, a couple appetizers(yakitori and mussels) and the crunch roll. The boat fish choices was at par, small cuts, one of the shrimp nigiri looked like it was dropped on the floor coz there was some dirt on top. The mussels were burned like rubber, yakitori was actually the highlight! 

When I ordered the boat, I specifically asked if they include some Cajun tuna...not one came with it! So disappointed, asked for a ponzu sauce, server gave us some chili garlic sauce! Ordered the Sapporo w/ free house sake, never came!!! I know it's a holiday but c'mon now, all we want is a little service, if you didn't want to work today then u should've jus stayed home! You can't even get napkins at this place, I was with my 3 kids smh' ...I don't know if it's just us coz she seemed to be very attentive to the other tables, maybe she don't like kids but I mean my kids were well behaved, no mess at all! Our bill came to $77 n change....left a $15 tip only coz it's a holiday today but we will never come back here again! Too many great sushi place in Vegas
If you like cucumber wrapped rolls... The Red Lady Roll is heaven. Buy 2 get one free specialty rolls? Yes please. The sushi chefs are charismatic and friendly as well. Love my local sushi spot!

Ugh, what more can I say? Always come here for the fresh sashimi, Shikoku shooters and whatever else after that....Oops, forgot about the amazing service from Steve, Feng & Meetchi and Brandi three thumbs up!

Went to see what Sawa was about pulled up and a sign on the door saying we will be closed on 7/11/17 with no reason given they did not update their yelp to show they were closed and we drove all the way over for no reason.

One of the better sushi restaurants in the local Las Vegas area. Fish is quality and they have very good special selections that vary.  No cheap fish here, I've seen them pull out the whole steak and slice fresh strips for their front fridge! Love the Chu Toro hand roll, it's a must try.  Great food, Great taste and good prices!
Had the Dragon, Catapillar and Unagi and they were all top notch. We will definitely be back real soon
I come here free work to get the Spicy Ahi Tuna salad. It's always fresh and delicious!
Haven't put any pictures on this place but is the best!! Is so fresh and yummy, had the sashimi, beer, and eel roll and it was so good gotta try the fatty tuna for sure!!!
Best place ever. Britt you Rock. This sushi place has the best fresh quality fish. Amazingggggggg
First time at this place ! Loved it, great service and reasonable prices.  Very much a hole in the wall.  Definitively will come again

Husband and I had the bento salmon lunch! Also had the chicken skewers Great as well..... 

Delicious great service! When in the area will come here to eat! 

Restaurant and restroom clean!!

The services was awesome and the sushi chefs were fast and energetic! Unfortunately, the sushi was just ok. The nigiris are what make me decide if I like the place or not. The fact that as simple as their ebi tasted "eh" made me not want to return. I've been to okay sushi places but they always have atleast the cooked shrimp right! I ordered a couple rolls too and they were just okay. I don't know how else to describe it but mediocre. 

Just like the other comments on here, I agree that the sushi wasn't tasty enough to be a la carte. Their sushi tastes more of an AYCE quality. Even then, I found really good AYCE places that should be a la carte! So overall, it was just an okay experience!

The food was quickly served, the fried items were hot and crispy, appetizers we had were awesome. Flavor and texture on Gioza was right on the money, the Adamame was hot and perfectly seasoned. We came in for a simple lunch and ended with a experience. We enjoyed the Bento plates. My wife and daughter enjoyed the Salmon and I had the tongkatsu element choices for us. Very well priced.

This was super amazing sushi. Very Japanese, very fresh and the staff was extremely friendly. The most basic thing about good sushi is the rice in the rice was flavorful and perfectly cooked. I asked for a piece of sushi with Shiso leaf And they obliged happily. The squid salad was exceptional, very crunchy and the squared was battery at the same time. I will stop in every time in Vegas to sample this treasure of a restaurant.
I live this place...crew always happy..best quality sushi...I have lived in Vegas since 1984....this is my place
Honestly blown away by the loving staff, good service & great food! For sure my new fave restaurant
Wow what a great place! So friendly- but most importantly fresh! Found this little gem yesterday and we are back the next day it's a must try!!!
Sushi here is really fresh. Service great. But what really Won me over was the garlic albacore roll. So good. Garlic lovers you need this roll in your life. I will come here every Vegas trip.

Um, 5 blue point oysters for $6.95!!???!!!???? Heck yes!! And they had an incredible light sauce on top. I'm coming back here for just them. And they have a great "buy 2, get one free" on the special rolls, which are a decent portion size. Spicy garlic edamame was perfect too. Quality and service was spot on. Coming back soon!!

This place is delicious! The sushi is all fresh and so good. My kids split the chicken Katzu bento place and they loved it. The staff was very friendly and attentive!! Definitely my favorite sushi spot!
Like the other reviews this place is great. Very friendly staff. Very reasonable price. Everything was extremely fresh. You should try this place at least once if you have the chance!
Sushi was really good.  And service was super fast and very friendly.   The tempura asparagus roll was awesome!

Went here the other day for lunch and Sawa Sushi did not disappoint!  They are much like other Sushi restaurants offering similar foods, however, the quality of the servings, quantity and presentation were totally top notch!  The room setting is somewhat small, but comfortable enough and cozy enough to have small talk conversation.

One thing I noticed is immediately when you walk in, you're greeted with a banner in your face.  Not a bad thing, just kind of different I guess.  I'm not sure if it's there on purpose or a gag, but something we chatted about at lunch with my colleagues.  Aside from that a very easy menu to read and order.

My entree consisted of the Teriyaki Chicken Bento Box and let me tell you it did not disappoint.  Check out my picture posted to see how generous the portions were.  I didn't leave an ounce of food unfinished.  I especially really enjoyed the side salad part of my dish.  Usually the side salads at Japanese restaurants miss the beat in my opinion, but Sawa Sushi delivered ten fold.  It had a hint of thousand island and Italian vinegarett?  It was a very good dressing whatever it was, forgot to ask.  So good I've been craving it again for the last two days.

The wife had chicken potstickers and that was just as good.  Very few times do I enter a restaurant where I'm truly amazed at every dish that comes out.  All of it was delicious!  I haven't stopped thinking about come back for two days now.  I guarantee I'll see myself coming back many more times.

I wish they had all you can eat!  Decided to try instead of driving across town to an all you can eat and it was really good!   They didn't have a tiger roll, so they created that for me!  Awesome!   The chefs special rolls were buy 2, get one free, which I wish I knew at the time of ordering the tiger rolls!  I was told after I'd piled all our dishes together and asked if I wanted the free one!  Regardless the food was really good.  My toddler had the kids chicken yakitori which came with 2 scoops of rice and some veggies on the side.  She ate almost everything , which is unusual.  My teen son had the California roll and loved it.   Overall everything was really good!  We will definitely be back!  
Ps. Consider doing AYCE!

Amazing volcano roll!!!!  The presentation is beautiful & taste great!!!  Friendly staff, clean, great prices & everything is really good quality.  Hard to find good sushi spots like this close to home.  So glad we found this spot... Even better that it's next to target lol

Convenient location. Food comes out fresh and hot. Love the Buy 2 get 1 free sushi rolls and you can mix and match. Friendly waiter. Pretty small location  so try not to come with party of 15 at that point you should buy the spot out for an hour . ( got greedy and stoped taking photos but these were pretty delish)

The sushi was good, and we sat right at the bar with no wait.  The chef's are fast and friendly, as were the waitresses.  The price is the reason for a 3 star instead of 4.  Two of us racked up an $80 bill and we ate less than normal knowing it's not AYCE.  There are better options for AYCE at a lower price point.  If they ever offer AYCE, I will be back.  Too pricey for average sushi as is.

Quiet and Quaint. I like the vibe. There are so many rolls available as well as a nice Noodle selection. The Toro (Fatty Tuna) Sashimi was awesome. Great flavor and fresh. Also can't beat the: Buy 2 Specialty rolls, get 1 free.
First time in was with my wife. We were in the mood for sushi so we stopped by Sawa and we can't stop eating here..

We are repeat customers and love this place.  The quality and hospitality are top notch.  You can't beat the everyday special of 3 rolls for the price of 2.  Fantastic flavors and selection.  Definitely go there if you can.

I thought the food was top notch. I understand opening a new restaurant is tough so maybe more training for the servers would go a long way. Overall the sushi was actually high quality standards which that is what I'm reviewing because when it comes to sushi that's what is important.

The customer service here is great, all the employees are so respectful. Miso soup always cure hang-over for me so I been there multiple times for miso soup (ha ha) I also had their barbq green mussel(it's amazing try it). GREAT SERVICE LITERALLY!

Poor service. Only one waitress serving the whole place. Seated ourselves.  Got menus ourselves.  Sat for 10 mins before ordering a drink.  Got part of meal before appetizers.   DO NOT try the lunch special rolls. You'll get better ones at the local supermarket.    My husband had sushi he said the quality was excellent but portion size way too small.  He loved the salmon cakes.
Great Sushi! In town for a week and this is our second trip here already. Great sushi, great service and good value! I would highly recommend!!!
This is a newer place but fantastic. The Dynamite baked roll was the best I've ever had. I love sushi and this was top shelf. Well done and I hope they do well there. I will be back! !

Awesome establishment! The sushi chefs here are really passionate about their craft and value quality over quantity. Their buy 2 get 1 free is a great way to try a variety of their rolls. Definitely a nice change of pace to all the AYCE sushi in town.

Was shopping and decided to try something new. When we walked in it was a cute little spot and the staff was very friendly. We looked over the menu and order water. When the waitress came, we both ordered bento boxes which were recommended. I don't like miso soup, so I asked for a double serving of the ginger salad, and the waitress said not a problem. I also ordered a Sapporo. The waitress brought out our salad and soup, and there was a creamy white dressing on my salad, I asked what it was and she stated it was a creamy dressing, I explained that I asked for ginger dressing and she ran to the back to fix. After a few minutes wait, she came back with a salad that had what looked like a soy sauce/oil dressing on it. I have to say it was absolutely awful!!! It tasted like salty, oil and dirt. I then motioned the waitress to let her know I still hadn't received my Sapporo, which I now needed to wash down the dirt taste in my mouth. 

After about 15 minutes, we were served our bento boxes, which although looked appetizing had no flavor. I stopped eating and so did my friend. Within 10 minutes, both of our stomachs were turning, and we immediately left the restaurant. As of this morning, we were both up with horrible stomach pain all night, and I'm pretty sure we both have food poisoning.

Simply Brilliant. 

Cold winter nights ignite my adventurous side to seek out new dining. Craving sushi I stumbled upon this humble & unassuming restaurant.

The moment you walk through the door, you're greeted by the booming voice of the sushi chefs hard at work creating their masterpieces. Wait staff got me seated immediately! 

A personal favorite, the chu toro is quite simply brilliant! Soft, succulent & quite delightful, the chu toro is something that I'll be fantasizing about tonight. 

The broad range of specialty rolls & the buy two get one free will leave you feeling stuffed. Craving spicy tuna after the chu toro I opted for the Baja roll, bonzai & spicy sea. Whilst the Baja & spicy sea delivered a little heat, neither came close to bonzai's. The siracha & jalapenos are subtle enough & meshes with the overall flavor. Their creations are for all to enjoy. Only the freshest of fish will do & sawa delivers. 

With prompt service, personable sushi chefs & the freshest of fish. Sawa has found themselves a loyal fan.

I took my family to eat her here for lunch, it was the best sushi we have eaten in Las Vegas. The staff was attentive, polite, and we're passionate about their craft. The spicy tuna was the best I have ever eaten. The chefs may secretly be Samurai. They're rolls were perfect.  I will eat here again and again.

Fresh fish here!!! Whenever I'm craving real sushi, I'll come here to Sawa and they never disappoint. The head chef is amazing and entertaining. Staff is attentive. They've been having the buy 2 get one roll free for awhile now. Still the best deal in town if you want fresh sushi!
Great food and very good service! They are super friendly and I was very pleased with the quality of the sushi and appetizers!

Its one of those ideal hole in the wall restaurants, doesnt look much from the outside, but the ambiance inside is a game changer. The oriental feel, the sushi chef within eyes length, the friendly staff, coupled with amazing food, is a well-earned 5 star. 

PS. Their Las Vegas Roll is AHHmazing.

This place is #OUTOFBOUNDS #FLAVORTOWN with a great staff. Food is fresh as can be and bottom line its fantastic. Call ahead and see if Niko is working you wont regret it. I had the Ichiban Roll and the Miso, they were both outstanding.

I LOVE this place.i happened to come in the very first week it was open & loved it ever since . The owner is very friendly & welcoming , both waitresses are warm ,helpful & friendly & the sushi is amazing .
You buy two rolls & get the third free. I love the peach cold sake, light & very flavorful.

Age is getting the better of me as I am no longer able to devour plates and plates of AYCE sushi. In a sense i'm glad no more having to find ways to hide my last few pieces in miso soup bowls or flattening them under two plates hahaha oh boy.... My friend wanted to get some sushi, and she saw sawa and guys it is sowwwaaa

Setting: A decaying "grand opening sign" is latched on the back of the restaurant, its right by the in n out on blue diamond. When you first walk in, they have that japanese mini curtain hit you in the face which my first instinct is "this is covered with face and dirty hair" so careful of that when you walk in. Pretty standard looking with the sushi bar and a few tables around.

Service: We had a younger white female server that just dropped off the menus to our table and walked away. So i was like ok.... morale here is bad. A different asian lady had come by later who provided better service by just being cordial. They had served as cucumber salad, and i asked if i could just seaweed or just anything else (i had cucumbers) and the chef had told the server he would charge me to replace it. Not a big deal but it would've been appreciated if he had accommodated. 

Food: They have deals here if you buy 2 rolls you get 1 free but I am not a roll eater whatsoever, so we got the Sawa Boat. $40 boat (chef selection of fish) but we were served standard pieces of nigiri and sashimi (tuna, salmon, yellowtail). The quality of the fish was pretty decent. 

Overall: Don't come here. It's really below average with nothing about it to spark any interests.
This is the only place I get sushi anymore! The staff is amazing and friendly, always give me a warm welcome. They just added a new roll called the winter roll and it's my new favorite!

Came here because I was in the area running errands and was thankful I got to try this place. I got their salmon bento box to go and it was awesome! The lady was very friendly and greeted me when I came in. They have special going on if you buy two special rolls you get one free. Definitely have to come back here to dine here. I was so happy with my lunch meal. The salmon was delicious and they give you a good amount of food. They aren't cheap on the food they give you. You also get 8 pieces of California roll and some fried tempura! Everything was delicious! Loved this place!

My husband and I were running errands in the area and found this sushi restaurant in the same parking lot. We were very happy with the sushi and service we received here. 

As soon as we walked into the restaurant we were warmly greeted by the waitress and the sushi chef. The waitress gave us a couple of seating options and took our drink orders right away. Our food came out quickly and our drinks were continuously refilled. The waitress was friendly and attentive. 

The menu here is great, offering a large selection of sushi, 55 types of rolls (!), and ramen among other items. Everyone will find something to enjoy here. 

I started with a House Salad with creamy dressing and Edamame. The salad was packed with greens and other vegetables. The dressing on top was delicious. 

We shared a Crispy Rice Roll, a Spicy Girl Roll, and a Godzilla Roll. All of them tasted great and tasted fresh. The Crispy Rice Roll was my favorite. It was crisp without being greasy.

LELV! we are all the way in the SouthWest side of Vegas.  Hanging out in a very nice and quiet spot Sawa Sushi.  You won't be disappointed here,  the fish is fresh and service is excellent. Pick anything on the menu and enjoy!
This place is solid. Great to have high quality sushi in the area. Im coming back often. Highly recommend this spot if you are picky about sushi places.

I was excited to have another Sushi place nearby.  I was disappointed they did not offer AYCE....but that's ok.  I have not had a good bento box in a long time.  Let's see how they do.  
I ordered HOT GREEN TEA to drink and it came warm.  In fact barely warm.  I could barely taste the tea- tasted more like just water.  Started with CALAMARI and it came like onion rings.  No tentacles- and the only dipping sauce they gave with it was this tabasco looking thing.  My son had YAKITORI and it was hardly tasty.  It was good it had sauce on it.  My Godfather ordered this this SUSHI COMBO.  We both had MISO SOUP....it lacked taste but at least it was hot.  It tasted like those instant MISO SOUP you add water to and like too much water was added.  My BENTO BOX- omg...the so-called Grilled Beef Teriyaki ...looked like wet beef- no taste.  The salad was your typical mixed greens and the  dressing is really important and that was like it was mayo mix IDK what flavoring it had.  The Tempura: Shrimp looked like it was on the skinny side, one tiny sweet potato, one tiny broccoli and I think a small zucchini.  The Tempura dipping sauce- it was not watered down correctly because it was too strong, and too sweet.  The Cali Rols was ok.  
I would have ordered more to see if maybe something else might have been good...but at this point I was already turned off. 
I usually try a place a couple of times just in case they were having a bad day with their service or whatever but BLEH!
Wonderful sushi at buy 2 get one free. Alaska my favorite. Crab patty okay but hubby loved it!  Tempura bananas with ice cream are great.

I really enjoyed coming here. It's a very small and not easily noticed location, but I felt very much like they wanted to make sure I was taken care of and that I enjoyed my dinner. Everything I tried was very good and I even had repeat orders of the garlic tuna nigiri. I'll be back!
This is some of my favorite sushi I have ever had. The quality is fantastic. The flavors are amazing. And the price is totally worth what it give you. Totally worth the 5 stars! Go here!!

This was my first visit and I really enjoyed it. The food was excellent. The staff was very attentive and nice. And the chef was very funny and interactive when yo sit at the bar. This is my new go-to sushi spot.

Sawa sushi special roll buy 2 get 1 free lol
Everything very good. Fresh fish.good server. Nice chef

We were greeted upon entering the doors with a friendly traditional shout out! Our food came out really fast, the service was exceptional, prices are very reasonable, and the food was delicious and fresh! Definitely recommend this place! There was a grand opening special where you get one special roll free when you order two special rolls.

This is a cute little sushi spot that has a couple great specials that run all day every day.

FOOD-Their signature rolls are always buy two get one free which is great deal. I find the quality of the sushi extremely delicious for the price. Taste like most sushi joints around the city . My boyfriend, my cousin, and her friend all enjoy this place as well. They also have some great combination platters if you don't want just rolls. They do not have all you can eat sushi. 

DRINKS-If you buy a large Sapporo you get a house sake for free. In my personal experience with ALL house sake's, they are never the best tasting sake's but it's free and it taste great for free. They also have delicious Arnold Palmer's which can either be raspberry flavored or regular depending on what they have that day. 

SERVICE-Every time I have been in they have the same kind waitress with dark hair who always has a smile on her face and it's nice to everybody. The chefs are also very friendly if you choose to sit at the bar. Great service all around. 

PARKING-Plenty of parking as this place sits in a shopping parking lot

ATMOSPHERE-Small, cute and clean. Nice music playing while you eat.

DEALS-Listed above under food and drink
This place was amazing. Great food and service. I would highly recommend it. I will Def  go back.
The best Japanese Restaurant/sushi bar I've been so far in Vegas! Everything tastes fresh and so delicious, the ambiance feels like you're really in Tokyo! A must must try!

I've been looking for a laid back sushi place near my house that's not too pricey! Great food! And greet service! The sushi chefs are very nice and when you walk in they great you. 
Only thing is I wish their rolls were a little bigger. Then run a tad smaller than what I'm used to from the places I've been to living in Orange County CA.
Bought the Red Dragon and Crabby Patty. Got a third roll free. Best Sushi since The Sushi House in Alameda

This place is great! I live in the area and come here often after doing shopping in the complex it's in. The staff is fantastic and attentive! My glass is never empty and I never have to wait long for my next round of sushi. The Hawaiian roll is a must try!  Fantastic!

Best local sushi but it beats the strip with the quality & the amazing good vibes with the restaraunt being family owned it lifts up the quality over quantity!!  The sushi chef Nikko was at 10/10 with quality of the grade of sushi & his positive energy!! I'm definitely coming back here again!!
Food was great!  We will be here again!  We had the salmon poke and the Sakura sushi convo.  Tasty and fresh!  The ginger was very fresh!

My husband and I order out from here frequently, and we never regret it. We always arrive early to pick up our order and it's truly hypnotizing to watch the chef do his work. We always have the same sweet lady to help us, and it's always the same chef as well, which is nice. This place has great food, great service, and a great environment as well. Would highly recommend.

This review is solely for the Chirashi Bowl. At $18, it is a terrible deal. Just a few pieces of fish and a ton of rice. We told the server about this at the end and she just laughed and walked away (she was quite pleasant during the meal, maybe it was a nervous laugh, after all she doesn't make the food). We've ordered lots of Chirashi Bowls in the past and this one was by far the worst. Advice to the owners - please don't be so stingy with the amount of fish in the Chirashi Bowl going forward.

Walked in with my daughter and sat at a small table. The waitress was great. I got the Japanese Lasagna and In & Out roll. She recommended the Volcano Roll since the rolls are Buy Two, Get One Free. The first one that she brought over was the Japanese Lasagna. It was delicious! Even my 1 year old loved it. The 2nd roll was the Volcano, and that was by far my favorite of the 3. The In & Out roll was very good too. This place is near my home and I will definitely be back. The service was fast and great!

I was up in the air whether to eat there or take it to go.   When I drove up, the Sapporo sign, showing through their front window was soo inviting that I decided to eat there.  As a matter of fact,  Sapporo was the first thing I ordered.   Unfortunately,  they ran out of Sapporo.   What a bummer... that's ok cuz I decided to take a bento box to go and drink my own beer at home (cheaper).  

I ordered the teryaki beef bento box and added an order of  spicy tuna roll.  They did not hold back on the amounts.   Geez, for under $20 I felt I came out winner.   Teriyaki sauce and tempura sauce were on point.  Didn't care too much for the salad and the california roll.  Everything else is what I expect of a bomb bento box; vegetable and shrimp tempura,  miso soup and rice.   

My goto spot for Japanese take home for sure.  I suggest calling your order in instead of waiting.   Gets uncomfortable waiting for food to go when there isn't a waiting area.    

 I'll give another review when I actually eat there but definitely going to call first to make sure they got Sapporo.   Can't imagine stuffing myself with sushi without it.

We stopped in here on out way out of town as we headed back to San Diego. It was about 2om, so it wasn't very busy and we got seated right away. 

The place is small, but the ambiance is nice. There is a small sushi bar towards the back and tables in the rest of the space. There was only 1 waitress, but she was prompt on serving us.
