My husband ordered a Tonkotsu Ramen, and I ordered the Tuna Tataki. My sushi came out about 5 minutes before his ramen, so I waited for his until I started eating.

I loved the tataki. The sauce had just enough of a kick to make the dish appetizing but didn't make the taste unbearable. There were 12 pieces, which for $13 (I think) is a deal. The tuna was on top of a bed of rice noodles and they were also delicious.

My husband's ramen was a bit plain. There was no egg, no hearts of palm, no seaweed, no pickled ginger, none of the regular items you usually find in tonkotsu ramen. On the upside, the pieces of meat in the soup were very generous. He ordered his spicy, and said the same as my dish, that it was just spicy enough to make the dish taste really good. He was disappointed though about not having an egg and asked for one on the side. They apparently didn't have any boiled so he ended up finishing his soup before our waitress came back over and apologized that the egg would be another 5-10 minutes. She offered him another piece of pork, but he passed on it since he was already finished with his soup.

Overall, we may be back when we come into town again, but he won't be getting the soup.
Excellent sushi, great service very nice atmosphere.  Met chef Steven at Ohjah years ago,  it was really nice to find him back behind a sushi bar :) Definitely a new place to hangout.

It's a Japanese sushi  place that you will not be disappointed.  I will definitely come back.  I highly recommend it.  Server was so hospitable, friendly and nice.  Chef was great!!!!!  My whole entire family loved it.
This will be our new sushi place to go! They may not have all you can eat but they have a boat for $40... which is cheaper when you look at quality.  Very friendly and yummy food.... I am sold!

This was my first time at Sawa Sushi, my  friend had gone with his son & enjoyed Sawa and today was my lucky day....he decided we would enjoy it this evening. Wen was our waitress and Steven the owner was as gracious and welcoming as could be. We proceeded to order several rolls & each that came out was better than the last. We closed the restaurant and even though late our timeliness was met with s smile and graciousness. Thank you Steven for making my 1st experience at your quaint restaurant very enjoyable.  I will tell all my friends!!! After  47 years in Vegas you will be on my radar!!! Again thank you!! And... Thanks for the smile!!! 

P.S. Wen is great!!!

$8.95 for a Lunch Teriyaki Bento box (incl. Rice, salad, teriyaki chicken, veggie and shrimp tempura and 4 pc California roll) is as good as it gets! Its fast and there is always a table, no wait time whatsoever. 

Here is my take on this place
1. Bathrooms are clean 
2. Wait staff are always sweet, fast and attentive 
3. Food is great 
4. Great price for the food

LOVE this place.  The rolls are unique but they have a lot of traditional stuff.  Staff are SO nice.  This place is pretty new and a lot of the staff are from a different place that we used to go to but stopped going to once the staff for bad.  For sure come here!!!

I've been out of touch for a while but I will say this. The rolls here are delicious. They have this buy 2 get one free deal so that's cool. But it is a little pricey. We had 3 rolls 4 hand rolls and salmon Kama it all came out to about $70 that was including tip. The way they make their Ponzu sauce here is awesome and they are really nice. But I'm giving this 3 stars because I feel you can get more bang for your buck at an AYCE. I didn't even order any nigiri so that should tell you that I didn't leave feeling full.

I came here for the first time to order lunch special Togo.
I came home disappointed. Whoever pack the food are sloppy. The sauce got all over the rice. We order 2 beef teriyaki and the beef portion was so little for $10. Would not recommend this place.

My husband and liked this place. We stopped in on a Tuesday around 2pm and had a pleasant lunch. We had the spicy California roll, gyoza and spicy garlic edamame. The edamame was VERY spicy, but I liked it. We also got free sake because we ordered a large Sapporo. The prices for special rolls are steep, but if they are as good as everything else we had, it's worth it
Had some really great rolls! Dha, mistake and rainbow were all very good. Sashimi was very fresh. Highly recommend the salmon sashimi.  Staff was very friendly and attentive.

The service was good, and the food presentation was good. HOWEVER, I ordered 4 dishes which were oysters, and 3 rolls. EVERY SINGLE DISH WAS DRIPPING IN THE SAME SAUCE!!!! Their disgusting orange vinegar sauce was not only in all my oysters, but also smothering all of my rolls! I literally couldn't taste anything in any of my food except their disgusting orange vinegar sauce. It's an Americanized sushi restaurant for sure. Great people, horrible fish/sushi.

Omg I love this place! Best sushi bar in town- hands down! And buy two get one free on speciality rolls? My husband and I literally pay $25 and we're stuffed! It's amazing. 

My favorite is the coconut shrimp roll- so damn good! 

He's obsessed with the Hawaiian. 

The 3rd roll is always something we haven't tried yet and we have never been disappointed. 

Staff is always so accommodating and so welcoming. If you live on this side of town...you should definitely try it. You'll be pleasantly surprised. You'll see.

This is my first time here and it's really amazing wow!  It's delicious!  The food was FRESHLY PREPARED and  the food was delicious! Came here to visit Las Vegas and was craving sushi! 
  Here some photos of the amazing food! 
If you're craving sushi this is the place to go!

honestly one of the best sushi i've ever bad. these people know how to make sushi. the rice is supposed to fall apart people, not stay compact. thats the first sign of poor sushi skills and this place was perfect. flavors were great. highly recommend the dynamite roll!

This is my second time ordering Sushi from this restaurant and I feel they deserve a review. I've enjoyed every meal so far. Actually, it surprises me how full you can get on sushi. They are very friendly here and helpful to their customers. I've ordered the usual California Rolls, Spicy Tuna, Volcano Rolls, and Japanese Lasagne Roll. ALL were delicious. The Volcano and Japanese Lasagne Rolls were  amazing. The awesome part is when you order two specialty rolls, you get one free. The California Rolls here are not bad. I liked the Spicy Tuna Rolls, but they kinda bored me. I'll definitely be back.

Wow Wow Wow, I was driving around really looking for some take-out after my conference ended and I was driving back to the hotel.  I saw this place as I was about to turn around and then looked it up on Yelp and figured, what the heck, it was already 9pm but on Sunday they were still open. 

i was immediately greeted by 2 sushi chefs in traditional Japanese style like you mostly get in Japan.  I told them you give me what you suggest.  They gave the DHA roll and it was great, the other roll was very nice. the rainbow roll wasn't the best, they use imitation crab which isn't my favorite.

I also had some squid salad that was nice. For 3 rolls and some fresh sashimi I was bursting and couldn't nearly finish it all but with a beer, a free saki under $50 out the door is pretty good.

I wanted to give them 5 but the Rainbow roll at the end locked in 4, but this place for Las Vegas is seriously good, it is a hole in the wall but worth finding. If I'd bought this much sushi at a srtip hotel it would have 2x and no better.
Decent for the price but the server and the owners are really nice and friendly but the fried tempura kind of sucks besides that the sushi is good

Our first time visiting, have been wanting to try them since they opened. We went in for lunch around the holidays. It was pretty dead, so we got great service. We got the buy two rolls get the third free (In and Out Roll, Winter Roll and Crunch Shrimp Roll) and an order of Jalapeno Tuna Poppers (not sure what they call them). Everything was really good. I can't wait to go back and try some more.
Prices on par with most for a Special Sushi Roll.

Highly recommended. They tell you how fresh their seafood items are and very friendly staff. Sit at the bar when you dine In. Ask for sushi chef Steven and go for the specials. Ohh and if y'all like uni or Spanish mackerel... one of the freshest in town! Oishi Kata!
People  are great,  fast service.   Food is excellent. Stopped by twice while in Las Vegas.

We've come to this sushi restaurant a few times now and each time we love it more and more! They always have the deal for 3 speciality sushi rolls for the price of 2! All the sushi is fresh and perfectly prepared.  There are so many different rolls to pick from! All the ones we've tried are delicious. 
Today we were in and out within 40mins. Service is amazing. We always have Brittany as a server and she's amazing! Today she was the only server on shift with 8 tables and she was still on top of her game. Her service is impressive. 
So happy to have found our date night spot. Highly recommend coming here!

Quality and freshness wise I would say this place is on par with the "all you can eat" deals you find all around town here.  I thought the portions are a bit small considering the prices. 

They are running a buy 3 speciality rolls for the price of 2 as a grand opening special. If you're able to take advantage of the special deal, the place seems more worthwhile. I don't recall seeing if they offered an AYCE option at this place. 

Service was fine, servers were helpful, courteous, and attentive. 

I've not had a chance to try the bento boxes or salads, ultimately I will be returning for another meal.

Sooooo good! I go on my breaks every once in a while and I love this place! They always greet you when you first come in! The sushi is probably the best I've had in Vegas. And I love their buy two get one free deal!!! Must try!

I have been without sushi in 6 months (working at a lake in Oregon) & needed a fix. We used to go to Hamada's on Flamingo but they are no longer open. So we checked Yelp! and found Sawa. 

It was in a shopping center so I wasn't so sure but we were starving so in we go. The sushi chefs are so friendly & welcoming! I'm getting more confident! And if you get a large Soporo, you get a free saki! That really says welcome!! Steven was our guy. He was fast & they were made well. 

Big menu with all the standard sushi selections. We started with 2 nigiri salmon (me) & 1 nigiri red snapper (him). The pieces aren't huge but a good one bite (2 for me). The salmon was very good-favorite and the red snapper was topped with a very tart marinade-not my favorite. 

My husband also got a Bento Box with chicken teriyaki. It also came with salad-good but needed more dressing, miso soup- so delicious we got one to go , 2 pieces shrimp tempura-good crunch & excellent flavor & 2 pieces vegetable tempura-amazing (the sweet potato-YUM-another favorite! It also came with a scoop of rice & a California roll (which we don't normally get but was really good!)

I also got a spicy tuna roll. The nori was too chewy like it had been open too long but the flavor was still ok.

The beer & saki, 3 nigiri sushi, HUGE bento box of food, the roll & extra miso soup to go came to $50. Good price for all the food we got. Maybe not the biggest or best we've had but good- food 3.5, Steven 4.5 so round to 4. We were full  & definitely will come back.

Worst service ever! I ordered a take out, but 2 rolls get 1 free. Came after work, wanted sushi, good deal... I waited for 35 minutes! I kept asking about my order... I understand if they are busy, the server could at least say about 30 to 40 or so wait! So I asked for my $$ back and left after waiting 35 minutes! Waste my time! Good food but service is not great- going to Sushi Mon way better service.

The place is small but nicely decorated, great atmosphere and comfortable. Our server was a nice lady - we think she was Japanese. And that made me all excited because it's gotta be authentic! Most sushi restaurants here now are mostly own by Korean or Mexican sushi chef, although that's not necessarily bad at all but I'm just saying I'm expecting something authentic here at Sawa. 

However, I'm extremely disappointed at their sushi. It was very tiny and seemed poorly made. I said that because in Las Vegas now there's AYCE sushi everywhere. If you're not doing AYCE, you should provide higher quality or quantity of ingredients, and better presentation. For what I'm paying for, I wasn't satisfied with my sushi at Sawa. 

I ordered 3 different sushi, but they were made and delivered in 3 separate times. I have never been to a place that done that unless I sat at sushi bar, which felt little odd. So they were just tiny sushi, tiny fish on top, and no presentation what so ever. The fish was good though very fresh.

We also ordered hamachi kama. That was very very good. I would recommend order this instead of sushi for sure.

Hot tea is NOT complimentary - it's $2.25 per person. It was authentic good quality matcha. 

So if I'm craving for sushi - If I'm really hungry I would go somewhere AYCE. If I'm just having a little crave for raw fish, I would go for Soho because they're always generous on their portion with great quality. I wouldn't come back for sushi at Sawa again.

One for a great and personal waitress servicing our table she was the reason why we actually stayed to taste the rest of the food we ordered since...
Minus a  for 
-the sushi chefs who were rude and not accommodating to our requests (taking the skin off of the sashimi salmon as it should be especially with this price $25 for 5 different types of fish
-the albacore looked spoiled 
-the yellow tail didn't look fresh. 
-while looking over at our table whispering words and shanking their hands definitely made us feel as tho we shouldn't have done what we did such as return food that as not suppose to be served!
DID I MENTION-they put that fish back into their fish area after being out on our table(how did they know if we didn't touch it?) We actually ate/touched the pieces GROSS!!!!
Sorry I am Japanese and just returned from Japan and their service was impeccable along with their food! High expectations I suppose!

This place is a little pricey since it isn't all you can't eat. One roll with miso was $16 before tip. The music was a little annoying to listen to and kind of loud. l don't know maybe pick music that isn't talking about a girl trying to hook up with another's girls man and how she could love him better, but anyways... The Baja roll was really good! It has Spicy tuna with salmon and avocado on top!

Chief Nikko is the best, he goes out of his way to make sure your needs are met. Great food at a great price!!! The crew is like family and you feel welcomed right at the door. Love love love it here, we will be coming back!

Nikko is the man!!! The staff was great and the atmosphere was spot on! The sushi was amazing; Innovative, fresh and flavorful. I highly recommended the Omakase - let Nikko work his magic, you won't regret it! I am definitely coming back! Party.
It is my second time here. All dishes are as good as the first time. Great price with great service. 100% satisfy.

Visiting Vegas with my son and he loves sushi, tried the dragon roll, rainbow, also the crab appetizer was amazing. Fresh and great deal located across from Target, small family owned business stop by if you like sushi.

This place has some good quality sushi . 
It's small and cute and the music is great . The servers were nice and it facilitates great conversations .

We have been waiting for Sawa to open for over a month now and are more than satisfied with our first experience. We ordered 3 rolls, the Crunch Shrimp Roll, the Rainbow Roll, and the star of the show... DHA Provider. --- EXCELLENT --- Steven the owner and Sam are super nice and very attentive. Our waitress, Crystal, was happy to educate and suggest her favorites. We'll be back for sure!!

We discovered Sawa pretty randomly (because it's near Target LOL), and my girlfriend's coworkers were eating there!
It's Really Good, awesome friendly service and the prices are very reasonable. The nigiri and rolls are made with nice fresh ingredients too. Check it out!

It's time for you to hire a new chef. Tonight we heard repeatedly that the chef is new. I would give you zero stars if that was an option. 

My husband and I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki and Tempura Bento boxes. I ordered the yellow tail collar for my daughter (13). We ordered soda and tea for each of us as well. $12.95 bento boxes x2, $9.95 yellow tail collar, and $1.99 drinks x3. Not worth it. 

We waited for almost an hour for our food to be served. People that had entered before us (they ordered sushi) were finished before we were served our food! 

Finally the two bento boxes came out. FYI: they do not have regular soy sauce. The rice was delicious. The California rolls were good. The salad was yummy. However, not all was great. Like, the lack of tempura in my bento box. There were 4 pieces of what looked like donuts with a vegetable in them. They were either oily and doughy, or oily and over cooked. Then there was the fact that they missed the shrimp tempura completely. On a bright note, my husbands bento box had all the pieces. The teriyaki chicken would have been better if it was hot, not luke warm. 

The yellow tail collar eventually came out. The yellow tail was meaty, but the center was cold. I could see there was uncooked spots but fed my daughter enough of the cooked spots. 

At this point, our food had come out and the servers who were very polite had to hear my complain. They repeatedly stated that the chef was new and that he was confused. Our server contacted the owner, Steven, and tried to get the entire bill erased. But -- that didn't happen. He did take off the yellow tail collar. 

It's time for a new chef because you'll lose your customers with this kind of food that you're serving.
Great place! The food was very good and the staff were extremely friendly. I'll come again!

Very fresh and very good quality sushi! Chef Steven is a very humble and friendly sushi chef! Highly recommended if you want sushi that is not like all other all-you-can-sushi places! Prices are well worth it!

We're here in town visiting family.  We came here for lunch after we landed. We were greeted by at least 2 people when we entered. That's at least three stars from the get-go for me!  My cousins ordered bento boxes and a roll, and we ordered rolls which were buy two, get 1 free.  The food came out fairly quickly, and the portions were on point!  I  know we ordered the ichiban, Krabby patty, lobster roll, and I can't remember the last. They were all good though!   Definitely a good lunch to start off our trip!

Everytime I go in, the owner makes me feel like I'm an old friend.  I'm sure he does that for everybody, but it's just refreshing to see someone respect their craft that much.  And, the sushi is legit.  Keep it up Sawa!

Place is amazing friendly staff, great service. Sushi is delicious. Had the DHA and volcano rolls. If you buy a large Sapporo you get a free sake perfect for bombs. Also buy two rolls get one free which was more than enough for me and my wife. We will be back soon to try the ichiban.
Fresh sushi, good service, great deals! I think I found my new sushi spot in mountains edge!

Buy 2 rolls get one free!!! There's no all you can eat but the service is great. Nikko and Aaron took real good care of me at the bar. They gave me good recommendations and they really know their stuff. If you're looking for an intimate setting or a good time this is a great spot to check out.

I'm glad I tried this place because it is close to my house, but never again...

DRINKS
* This place does NOT serve alcohol. NO SAKE and NO BEER.They say they are waiting for their liquor license... So maybe that will change.
* They do not have fountain sodas, only bottles.
* They have Pepsi products. (I like diet Coke)

SUSHI
Seaweed Salad - It was tasty but extremely small. It was the size of a seaweed salad you would expect at an AYCE (about a half cup, maybe less), but it was $4.50. For that price I would expect a good sized portion.

Las Vegas Roll - Deep fried rice. I like deep fried rolls but I like them when the rice is on the inside of the seaweed. The rice here is on the outside, there is a lot of it, and a lot of tempura. There is a small amount of salmon and cream cheese on the inside. I felt like I was eating fried dough, not sushi.

Ichiban Roll - The garlic sauce tasted nice, but lots of rice.

Oishi Roll - Yummy, but small and lots of rice.

This place adds rice to rolls and portions their items as if it is an AYCE, but it is NOT. For $12+ rolls, I expect better quality and quality of fish. They have a special going on now, buy 2 special rolls get one free, but you can go down the street to Ohjah and get their 3 roll special for the same price (and they serve large seaweed salads and sake at Ohjah)

There was one lady at the place talking about how much she loved it and how she had been there multiple times, but she also asked the waitress what NIGIRI was..? So she obviously has not had much sushi. Otherwise, we were on only customers there.

SERVICE
The waitresses were nice and quick, but the place was dead.

This place might be okay if they were an AYCE and you were ok with lots of rice, or if they had a happy hour, but definitely not a la carte at their current prices. There are so many better options.

My wife and I tried it for the first time today, and we were DELIGHTED! The food, the prices, the service, EVERYTHING was spot-on perfect. VERY impressed. I actually liked it better than "All You Can Eat", and we left satisfied, with a very small tab, even after Sapporo beer and sake for us both. I'd give them a sixth star if I could, because every member of the staff was so friendly! When we told the server we liked something, she went right over to tell the chef, and he came over to our table and thanked us! This is now our new sushi place!

Driving around not knowing what tI wanted for dinner. I opted for this little spot sat at the sushi bar, I was greeted  with a smile, I asked for recommendations on the food and I gotta say I was served with some very very DELICIOUS dishes.  Shikoku Oysters, Uni, Otoro, just to name a few.  I defiantly will return on my next trip to Vegas.

Place had the most amazing customer service. Yellow tail was super fresh. Music was great. Staff was attentive. I had my 3 kids with me and the waitress was so helpful. My son didn't want the salad that came with the bento box but I did. I told him to put it on a plate and pass it over. The waitress seen him struggling and came and did it for him.  It's the small thing that set them apart.

Sushi was very good. Had 3 different special rolls and the service was very quick. 

The bento boxes are a good size portion and deal for people as well as two of my coworkers had that. 

Only here for the week but I'd Come back if I came back into town.
